ygData.subject: Re: Here ya'll go!
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I was told that Skewers are good because they are so hard.  I guess it s sorta like when you are in combat, you learn combat skills faster if you fight
ygData.messageBody:
Golbez wrote:
>
> From: "Golbez" <golbez01@...>
>
> Here's some good questions and answers for every dark elf.
>
> Two ogre chicks in Foreign quarter have lots of molds. File being one of
> them. Not sure about skewer or scaler though.
>
> Guy in 2nd level of Toadstool Inn sells armor molds not sure where weapon
> molds are or .... really I've not heard anything about making weapons so I
> don't know anything about that. =)
>
> Ok what is better to make for skill improvement scalers or skewers? If
> there isn't one better then which is cheaper and where is it found in Neriak
> if possible.

I was told that Skewers are good because they are so hard. I guess it's
sorta like when you are in combat, you learn combat skills faster if you
fight somthing white than if you fight something blue or green.

I haven't priced Scalers, but my smith with an 80 charisma (dealing with
merchants who like him) has a total cost of 2.35 gold per skewer. That
includes the mold, the water, and all the costs that went into the metal
bits. Hope this helps some.

>
> And! Does anyone know if intellect directly affects smithing skill gain
> like it should affect most other skills.

It is my understanding that Intel directly affects smithing skill gain
llike others, but I didn't hear that from a GM or anything, so I could
be wrong.
